meanings.definition: Able to create or produce something new
meanings.sent1: The artist's originative ideas brought a fresh perspective to the gallery.
meanings.sent2: Her originative approach to problem-solving always led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent3: The originative chef decided to mix chocolate with chili for a surprising flavor combination.
meanings.sent4: His originative mind was like a fountain of endless creativity, always bubbling with new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The originative design of the building made it stand out among the rest, attracting many admirers.

meanings.definition: Serving to create or initiate something
meanings.sent1: The team's originative strategy kickstarted the project successfully.
meanings.sent2: The company's originative marketing campaign captured the attention of many customers.
meanings.sent3: The originative plan to use balloons instead of fireworks for the celebration was a hit.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an originative spark, lighting up the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The originative use of colors in the painting made it come alive, drawing viewers in.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to originate or invent
meanings.sent1: The inventor's originative mind led to groundbreaking technological advancements.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her originative solutions to complex problems.
meanings.sent3: The originative scientist accidentally created a potion that made plants grow ten times their normal speed.
meanings.sent4: His originative spirit was like a beacon of light in the world of art, guiding others to explore new horizons.
meanings.sent5: The originative storyteller weaved tales that transported listeners to magical realms beyond imagination.
